citation.article-title: Pyrobaculum gen. nov., a new genus of neutrophilic, rod-shaped archaebacteria from continental solfataras growing optimally at 100 C.

p.s: Description of Pyrobaculum islandicum, Stetter, Huber and Kristjansson, sp. nov.
Pyrobaculum islandicum (is.la'n.di.cum M. L. neutr, adj. islandicum Icelandic, describing the place of its first isolation)
Cells are usually about 2.5 μm long and exhibit bipolar polytrichous flagellation, each flagellum up to 15 μm long and about 13 nm in width.
V-shaped aggregates of 2 cells with different angles are formed.
Packed cells exhibit a green colour.
Growth at 74°C and in the presence of 0.8% (w/v) NaCl.
Optimal doubling time (in closed culture vessels) about 260 min at 100°C Facultatively organotrophic.
During organotrophic growth, S0, thiosulfate, sulfite, L(-)-cystine and oxidized glutathione serve as electron acceptors.
Isolates were obtained from boiling solfataric and geothermal waters in Iceland.
The type strain is Pyrobaculum islandicum, GEO3, DSM 4184, Göttingen, FRG.
